# ibea.ai - AI Math & Data Tools
# WebMCP-enabled tools for AI agent integration
# Base URL: https://www.ibea.ai

## Available Tools

### mathjs_evaluate
- URL: https://www.ibea.ai/t/mathjs-evaluate/
- Docs: https://www.ibea.ai/tools/mathjs-evaluate.md
- Description: Evaluate mathematical expressions with high precision. Supports arithmetic, algebra, trigonometry, logarithms, matrices, and more.
- Parameters: expression (string, required)

### mathjs_unit_convert
- URL: https://www.ibea.ai/t/mathjs-unit-convert/
- Docs: https://www.ibea.ai/tools/mathjs-unit-convert.md
- Description: Convert between physical units. Supports length, mass, time, temperature, volume, speed, energy, and more.
- Parameters: value (number, required), from (string, required), to (string, required)

### mathjs_simplify
- URL: https://www.ibea.ai/t/mathjs-simplify/
- Docs: https://www.ibea.ai/tools/mathjs-simplify.md
- Description: Simplify algebraic expressions. Reduces mathematical expressions to their simplest form.
- Parameters: expression (string, required)

### formula_parser
- URL: https://www.ibea.ai/t/formula-parser/
- Docs: https://www.ibea.ai/tools/formula-parser.md
- Description: Parse and evaluate mathematical formulas with variables.
- Parameters: formula (string, required), variables (object, optional)

### basic_math
- URL: https://www.ibea.ai/t/basic-math/
- Docs: https://www.ibea.ai/tools/basic-math.md
- Description: Perform basic mathematical operations using native Math functions.
- Parameters: operation (string, required), a (number, required), b (number, optional)

### chart_generator
- URL: https://www.ibea.ai/t/chart-generator/
- Docs: https://www.ibea.ai/tools/chart-generator.md
- Description: Generate data visualizations as charts. Supports bar, line, pie, doughnut, radar, and scatter.
- Parameters: type (string, required), labels (array, required), data (array, required), title (string, optional)

### stat_distribution
- URL: https://www.ibea.ai/t/stat-distribution/
- Docs: https://www.ibea.ai/tools/stat-distribution.md
- Description: Calculate probability density, cumulative distribution, and inverse CDF for statistical distributions.
- Parameters: distribution (string, required), fn (string, required), x (number, required), params (array, required)
